qas.question: What is Anthrozoology also known as?
What is the study of interaction between living things?
What does the field of anthrozoology overlap with?
What type of effects are a major focus of the anthrozoologic research?
What are some of the diverse range of fields scholars come to Anthrozoology from?
What is the study of animals?
What focuses on the positive affect of animals on humans?

context: <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Anthrozoology<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> (also known as "<a0_0>human–animal studies<a0_0/>") is the study of interaction between living things. It is a burgeoning interdisciplinary field that overlaps with a <a2_0>number of other disciplines<a2_0/>, including anthropology, ethology, medicine, psychology, veterinary medicine and zoology. A major focus of anthrozoologic research is the quantifying of the <a3_0>positive<a3_0/> effects of human-animal relationships on either party and the study of their interactions. It includes scholars from a diverse range of fields, including <a4_0><b7_0>anthropology, sociology, biology, and philosophy<b7_0/><a4_0/>.[n 7]
